alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 9:41AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Kit Carson County through 1015 AM MDT... At 940 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Burlington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Kit Carson County. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 430 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 184 and 192. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
